nodes.documentation: ************* FALLBACK FUNCTIONS (to be removed before public release) *************
nodes.name: fallbackClaim

approve(address,address,uint256).details: Need to approve the OpportunityManager contract

deposit(bytes32,uint256).details: The value added must be in the same coin type as the position

params.tokenId: - The unique id of the position
params.value: - The amount of value they wish to add     /// TODO: Check if need to check is valid portfolio since if token exists it'll have a valid portfolioId

lend(bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256,boo.details: Could pass in sha3 id and use _storage to find the appropriate contract address       but that is an extra external call when we can just do it free beforehand

params.opportunity: - The contract address of our Opportunity contract
params.opportunityId: - The opportunity id we're lending too
params.portfolioId: - The portfolio id we're lending for
params.subtract: - Flag to let us know if we wish to subtract value lent                 from the available capital.

params.beneficiary: - The owner of the position, supports third-party buys
params.value: - The amount to be invested, need so we can accept ERC20's

mint(bytes32,address,uint256).return: The unique token id of their RAY Token position

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.details: Must return hash of the function signature for tx to be valid.

params.from: - The last owner of the RAY before becoming us
params.tokenId: - the unique id of the position      /// TODO: find value of hash: bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)")) /       and make it a constant.

redeem(bytes32,uint256,address).details: Caller must be the owner of the token or our Payer contract (not finished)

params.originalCaller: - Unimportant unless Payer is the msg.sender, tells                            us who signed the original message.     /// NOTE:     We no longer force a RAY burn to unlock all value of the token

setApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Used by Admin so it can deprecate this contract, it transfers          all the opporunity tokens to a new contract.

params.token: - The contract address of the token

transferFunds(bytes32,address,uint256).details: If this is deprecated, should be no value, therefore this function will revert anyway, so we don't ned the deprecation flag since it won't help us debug the error in prod. since error msgs don't show up

withdraw(bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256.details: Could pass in sha3 id and use _storage to find the appropriate contract address       but that is an extra external call when we can just do it free beforehand

params.add: - Flag to let us know if we wish to add value withdrawn                 into the available capital.
params.opportunity: - The contract address of our Opportunity contract
params.opportunityId: - The opportunity id we're withdrawing from
params.portfolioId: - The portfolio id we're withdrawing for

deposit(bytes32,uint256).notice: Adds capital to an existing RAYT, this doesn't restrict who adds,          addresses besides the owner can add value to the position.

fallbackClaim(uint256,address,bool).notice: ************* FALLBACK FUNCTIONS (to be removed before public release) *************

lend(bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256,boo.notice: Entrypoint of the Oracle to tell us where/how to lend

mint(bytes32,address,uint256).notice: Allows users to send ETH or accepted ERC20's to this contract and          used as capital. In return the Controller mints and gives them a RAYT which          represents their 'stake' in the investing pool. A RAYT maps to many shares.          The price of shares is determined by the NAV.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.notice: Implemented to receive ERC721 tokens. Main use case is for people to burn          and withdraw their RAYT and withdraw the underlying value. This function checks          if the RAYT exists. Then it runs validation checks that if fail, would make the          calling RAYT invalid to be burnt and withdrawn. If it passes the checks, it clears          it's associated tokenValues data, burns the RAYT, and transfers the capital + yield

redeem(bytes32,uint256,address).notice: Part 1 of 3 to withdraw value from a RAY Position

transferFunds(bytes32,address,uint256).notice: Public wrapper so we can call via our Admin contract

withdraw(bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256.notice: Entrypoint of the Oracle to tell us where/how to withdraw
